content.raw:
Breaking all builds downstream, as I understand it, it would be not reasonable. If we have third party software built on top of sdformat4 it should keep working. 

If a system updates sdformat4 but that update requires the new version of the dependency present in the system, do you think that it will break existing code? Existing code relies on the sdformat4 libraries and sdformat4 libraries relies on whatever third party libraries it uses. As long as there is no ABI breakage, all should be ok. I could be perfectly wrong with the reasoning, but that was the one I used with this bump.

If a system updates sdformat4 but that update requires the new version of the dependency present in the system, do you think that it will break existing code? Existing code relies on the sdformat4 libraries and sdformat4 libraries relies on whatever third party libraries it uses. As long as there is no ABI breakage, all should be ok. I could be perfectly wrong with the reasoning, but that was the one I used with this bump.
